etymologies: mid 19th century (in an earlier sense). From mesite + -yl

definitions: A cyclic hydrocarbon group or radical derived from mesitylene, either (CH₃)₂ C₆ H₃ CH₂ — (3,5-dimethylbenzyl) or (now usually) specifically(CH₃)₃ C₆ H₃ — (2,4,6-trimethylphenyl). Usually attributive or as a formative element in chemical names.
